text: The word of the Lord that came to Joel the son of Pethuel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear this, ye old men,
and give ear, all ye inhabitants of the land.
Hath this been in your days,
or even in the days of your fathers?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Tell ye your children of it,
and let your children tell their children,
and their children another generation.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
For a nation is come up upon my land,
strong, and without number,
whose teeth are the teeth of a lion,
and he hath the cheek teeth of a great lion.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He hath laid my vine waste,
and barked my fig tree:
he hath made it clean bare,
and cast it away;
the branches thereof are made white.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lament like a virgin girded with sackcloth
for the husband of her youth.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
The vine is dried up, and the fig tree languisheth;
the pomegranate tree, the palm tree also, and the apple tree,
even all the trees of the field, are withered:
because joy is withered away from the sons of men.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Gird yourselves, and lament, ye priests:
howl, ye ministers of the altar:
come, lie all night in sackcloth,
ye ministers of my God:
for the meat offering and the drink offering
is withholden from the house of your God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sanctify ye a fast, call a solemn assembly,
gather the elders and all the inhabitants of the land
into the house of the Lord your God,
and cry unto the Lord,
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Is not the meat cut off before our eyes,
yea, joy and gladness from the house of our God?
speaker: Narrator

text:
The seed is rotten under their clods,
the garners are laid desolate,
the barns are broken down;
for the corn is withered.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
a day of darkness and of gloominess,
a day of clouds and of thick darkness,
as the morning spread upon the mountains:
a great people and a strong;
there hath not been ever the like,
neither shall be any more after it,
even to the years of many generations.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The appearance of them is as the appearance of horses;
and as horsemen, so shall they run.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Like the noise of chariots on the tops of mountains shall they leap,
like the noise of a flame of fire that devoureth the stubble,
as a strong people set in battle array.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Before their face the people shall be much pained:
all faces shall gather blackness.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
neither shall one thrust another;
they shall walk every one in his path:
and when they fall upon the sword,
they shall not be wounded.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The earth shall quake before them;
the heavens shall tremble:
the sun and the moon shall be dark,
and the stars shall withdraw their shining:
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Therefore also now, saith the Lord,
turn ye even to me with all your heart, and with fasting,
and with weeping, and with mourning:
speaker: Narrator

text:
and rend your heart, and not your garments,
and turn unto the Lord your God:
for he is gracious and merciful,
slow to anger, and of great kindness,
and repenteth him of the evil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who knoweth if he will return and repent,
and leave a blessing behind him;
even a meat offering and a drink offering
unto the Lord your God?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blow the trumpet in Zion,
sanctify a fast, call a solemn assembly:
speaker: Narrator

text:
gather the people,
sanctify the congregation,
assemble the elders,
gather the children,
and those that suck the breasts:
let the bridegroom go forth of his chamber,
and the bride out of her closet.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the priests, the ministers of the Lord,
weep between the porch and the altar,
and let them say, Spare thy people, O Lord,
and give not thine heritage to reproach,
that the heathen should rule over them:
wherefore should they say among the people,
Where is their God?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then will the Lord be jealous for his land,
and pity his people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yea, the Lord will answer and say unto his people,
Behold, I will send you corn, and wine, and oil,
and ye shall be satisfied therewith:
and I will no more make you a reproach among the heathen:
speaker: Narrator

text:
but I will remove far off from you the northern army,
and will drive him into a land barren and desolate,
with his face toward the east sea,
and his hinder part toward the utmost sea,
and his stink shall come up,
and his ill savour shall come up,
because he hath done great things.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Fear not, O land; be glad and rejoice:
for the Lord will do great things.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Be glad then, ye children of Zion,
and rejoice in the Lord your God:
for he hath given you the former rain moderately,
and he will cause to come down for you the rain,
the former rain, and the latter rain in the first month.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And the floors shall be full of wheat,
and the fats shall overflow with wine and oil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And I will restore to you the years that the locust hath eaten,
the cankerworm, and the caterpiller, and the palmerworm,
my great army which I sent among you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And ye shall eat in plenty, and be satisfied,
and praise the name of the Lord your God,
that hath dealt wondrously with you:
and my people shall never be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And ye shall know that I am in the midst of Israel,
and that I am the Lord your God, and none else:
and my people shall never be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And it shall come to pass afterward,
that I will pour out my spirit upon all flesh;
and your sons and your daughters shall prophesy,
your old men shall dream dreams,
your young men shall see visions:
speaker: Narrator

text:
and also upon the servants and upon the handmaids
in those days will I pour out my spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And I will shew wonders in the heavens and in the earth,
blood, and fire, and pillars of smoke.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sun shall be turned into darkness,
and the moon into blood,
before the great and the terrible day of the Lord come.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And it shall come to pass, that whosoever shall call on the name of the Lord shall be delivered:
for in mount Zion and in Jerusalem shall be deliverance,
as the Lord hath said,
and in the remnant whom the Lord shall call.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For, behold, in those days, and in that time,
when I shall bring again the captivity of Judah and Jerusalem,
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will also gather all nations,
and will bring them down into the valley of Jehoshaphat,
and will plead with them there for my people
and for my heritage Israel,
whom they have scattered among the nations,
and parted my land.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Yea, and what have ye to do with me,
O Tyre, and Zidon, and all the coasts of Palestine?
will ye render me a recompence?
and if ye recompense me,
swiftly and speedily will I return your recompence upon your own head;
speaker: Narrator

text:
because ye have taken my silver and my gold,
and have carried into your temples
my goodly pleasant things:
speaker: Narrator

text:
the children also of Judah and the children of Jerusalem
have ye sold unto the Grecians,
that ye might remove them far from their border.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, I will raise them out of the place whither ye have sold them,
and will return your recompence upon your own head:
speaker: Narrator

text:
and I will sell your sons and your daughters
into the hand of the children of Judah,
and they shall sell them to the Sabeans, to a people far off:
for the Lord hath spoken it.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
beat your plowshares into swords,
and your pruninghooks into spears:
let the weak say, I am strong.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Assemble yourselves, and come, all ye heathen,
and gather yourselves together round about:
thither cause thy mighty ones to come down, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the heathen be wakened,
and come up to the valley of Jehoshaphat:
for there will I sit to judge all the heathen round about.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Put ye in the sickle, for the harvest is ripe:
come, get you down; for the press is full,
the fats overflow; for their wickedness is great.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Multitudes, multitudes in the valley of decision:
for the day of the Lord is near in the valley of decision.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sun and the moon shall be darkened,
and the stars shall withdraw their shining.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord also shall roar out of Zion,
and utter his voice from Jerusalem;
and the heavens and the earth shall shake:
but the Lord will be the hope of his people,
and the strength of the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So shall ye know that I am the Lord your God
dwelling in Zion, my holy mountain:
then shall Jerusalem be holy,
and there shall no strangers pass through her any more.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And it shall come to pass in that day,
that the mountains shall drop down new wine,
and the hills shall flow with milk,
and all the rivers of Judah shall flow with waters,
and a fountain shall come forth of the house of the Lord,
and shall water the valley of Shittim.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Egypt shall be a desolation,
and Edom shall be a desolate wilderness,
for the violence against the children of Judah,
because they have shed innocent blood in their land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But Judah shall dwell for ever,
and Jerusalem from generation to generation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I will cleanse their blood that I have not cleansed:
for the Lord dwelleth in Zion.
speaker: Narrator
